alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Franklin; Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 07 at 8:52PM EST until February 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Apalachicola River near Blountstown affecting Liberty, Calhoun, Gulf and Franklin Counties. For the Apalachicola River...including Blountstown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Apalachicola River near Blountstown. * WHEN...Until Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, The boat ramp at Estiffanulga in Liberty County floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CST Monday /8:15 PM EST Monday/ the stage was 19.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CST Monday /8:15 PM EST Monday/ was 19.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Friday morning and continue falling to 15.7 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.6 feet on 01/27/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon.
